page.title: 06EXETER SWIMMING BATHS
page.content: Exeter swimming baths were built in 1938. It is a large building in the centre of the city and can cater for 2000 people a week. It is a 25 metre pool with two diving boards. It also has a refreshment room. It accommodates a fitness room, sauna and solarium. Most people who use the baths come from the Exeter area. It is run by Exeter City Council. The swimming baths has evening clubs and takes schools on Mondays and Wednesdays mornings. The pool used to be very bleak but now it has been brightened up a lot because before they just had a swimmimg pool but now a lot of additions have been made and it is even more popular. It is 25p for children, 70p for adults.
